rejection.details:
Planning decisions, such as decisions on public transport routes, and building more playgrounds, are the responsibility of local authorities, not the UK Government or the House of Commons. This means that neither the Government nor the House of Commons are directly responsible for the action your petition asks for.

You could start a petition to your local authority, Lancashire County Council, asking them to build more playgrounds and improve transport links in your area, if that is something you'd like to see happen. You can find out how to do this here: https://www.lancashire.gov.uk/council/get-involved/petitions/

You could also raise your issue directly with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
